page.title: 02Walton Hall,near Ryhill
page.content: Walton Hall is an eighteenth century mansion in Palladian style set on a small island in a lake which makes an attractive feature of the estate.Other interesting features include a mediaeval watergate __ a remnant of the earlier house on this site __ and an early cast-iron bridge which connects house and island with the lake shore.The hall is a listed building and stands amid attractive woodland and parkland. In the early nineteenth century the house was the home of Charles Waterton,the noted naturalist and explorer,particularly, of South America. The hall is now a country club and hotel offering accommodation and conference facilities as well as recreational activities including squash,fishing and water ski-ing.
